Reviews.Title: “Great hotel & location”
Reviews.Author: Hoops777
Reviews.Content: Very modern looking hotel with nice rooms and was quite spacious. Didn't try their breakfast for the surcharge as we decided to eat nearby each morning. WiFi was a good speed. Bathroom was fantastic with a double basin. Windows could be opened for some fresh air, but then it was noisy from the busy road below. Only thing stopping this from a 5 out of 5 rating was the air conditioning didn't work (or didn't get fixed after reporting to reception) and the toilet stopped working and despite getting maintenance in to fix the toilet it continued to fail. Location was in the Gothic quarter and only a block from Las Ramblas.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ExtremeHolidayer
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a couple of nights recently and were quite disappointed with our stay. We were not expecting a great deal but the quality of the room was extremely disappointing. The lobby was very modern and funky looking but we got a shock on arrival into our room. It was the smallest room we had ever stayed in and certainly not 4 star standard! There was barely enough room to close the door and walk in without stumbling into the bed. The room was extremely dark and there was one small window which overlooked 4 grey walls and a large drop. The bathroom was small and every single one of the rails for towels, etc was broken and would fall off the wall once touched. The shower was poor as the water pressure was very weak. Then there was the temperature problem! On our first night, we turned on the air conditioning and it appeared to be working fine. However, we woke up early the next morning to an incredible heat which made us both feel very ill. We asked reception if there was a problem and they said that the air conditioning was experiencing problems and was blowing out hot air instead of cool air. The staff were unapologetic over this issue and simply advised us to turn off the air con even though the heat in the room would be excessive without it. We were eventually transferred to another room but the problem with the air con remained and the room was still unbareably hot without any air conditioning. This along with the poor standard of the room, made us want to stay away from the hotel as much as possible. The location of the hotel is excellent but that is not enough to earn it's 4 star rating. We were very disappointed with our stay and would certainly not be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel/location”
Reviews.Author: Cindy P Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Very good/clean hotel. Great badroom.subway very close.a lot of interesting things in walking distance. Had a bit of bad luck with our neighbors. They came back at 6.00 am every day and were very loud. It could have been a bit better isolated, but that's the only negative thing. There's a nice coffee shop just 3 houses away. It's cheaper (and probably better) than te breakfast you can get in the hotel itself.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic experience”
Reviews.Author: AS-Rotherham
Reviews.Content: We approached the hotel with some trepidation having read previous reviews however our fears were unfounded. The room, 802, was spotlessly clean, fairly spacious and had a small balcony which had wonderful views over the city. Whilst the hotel was slightly "tired" in some of the public areas the location more than made up for this. The reception staff were extremely courteous and and even gave us an umbrella on our last day as the heavens opened. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location BUT!!!!”
Reviews.Author: C M Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: La Sagrada Familia is a mere two blocks away and Las Ramblas nearby. But, there was quite a bit of street noise which made it difficult to sleep. The hotel lobby did not feel clean. We could not control the temperature in the room and as a result the room was stifling hot. The staff was friendly and willing to help Do not have the hotel clerk call a cab for you. It will cost you an additional fee to have that done and there is a cab stand one block away.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, basic hotel”
Reviews.Author: arynfpf
Reviews.Content: Our experience was completely different from William M's. The reception staff were courteous and the room was clean, if on the small size. The bathroom was surprisingly large in comparison. There were only two things I didn't like: the bathroom was very dark (the only light is above the sink) and the crib for our daughter was frighteningly old and had a drop-side. Although, it was a nice touch to place a little stuffed toy in there for her! We didn't have any trouble with the elevator. The best thing about this hotel is its location (and the free bottled water didn't hurt either). We walked everywhere!

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT BOOK THIS HOSTEL !! THE WORST HOTEL I HAVE EVER STAYED IN !!”
Reviews.Author: William M
Reviews.Content: Myself & my fiance booked into this hotel, to enjoy a city break in Barcelona to celebrate his birthday. Can I just start by saying that we are normal working folk, we usually stay in 3/4 star hotels. We do not expect platinum service, we just expect a clean and pleasant stay. On arrival we were pleased with the presentation of the reception (very modern & jazzy). The receptionist appeared very friendly & spoke great English. When we were checking in, there was a current guest complaining that his room was too cold & that he had been promised the heating would be fixed the day before. This elderly man was then given a blanket. The lift upto the room was a scary ride, after waiting a good few minutes for it to arrive, it was very out-dated & unsafe looking & both myself & my partner got a mini electric shock inside (this continued to happen everytime we were inside it). Other guests had obviously clicked on to this, as everyone else seemed to always use the stairs. The corridor was dirty & hostel like. When we opened the room (305) door the bed was instantly there, the most compact room I have ever been in! The door basically touches the bed on opening. The room was really really dark, the lighting was poor & the two windows were covered by two blinds each, that were broke & unable to be rolled up! The view looked on to an immediate void space between 4 brick walls. Everything in the room seemed grubby, broken & unclean. The bed had one thin grey/white sheet over it. The TV had no signal. The 'minibar' with 3 bottles of water in it was warm. The towel rail was hanging off. The towels were rock hard. Sockets were actually hanging off the wall! But the most unbearable of all.. was the ice cold temperature!! I phoned down to reception & said the instructions for the safe had been cut in half & the room was cold. He just said read the instructions & hung up. We went down to reception & the receptionist who had previously spoke perfect English, was now really struggling to understand us?! We were finally told that the maintenance man would fix it while we were out for dinner. We returned to the hotel just after midnight. We were told "I dont know, I think so, take a blanket" when asked if the heating had been fixed. We refused the blanket & reluctantly returned to the room to check, and surprisingly it hadn't been fixed & it appeared that no one had been in our room at all. I again phoned the reception to be told that I was to try turning the heating off & on a few times. This did not work. Then I was told to close the windows... The windows were painted shut!!! We gathered our stuff & headed to reception. We were given the key to room 705, this room was worse than the previous & the heating also never worked!!! I refused to stay a minute longer in that pit! I was reluctantly offered a refund! Although the £180.18 has left my account, it has still not been refunded! My bank are now disputing this! Overall this hotel does not deserve 1 star!! It was unsafe, unclean, cold & the staff were selective in their service! This is the first review I have ever left, but I just want to warn people off! We had to walk around at 1am in search of a new hotel. We paid £20 more for an actual 4 star hotel called Hoteles Barcelona Centre... It was luxury!! Sorry for my rant, I am just truly appauled at the service we recieved!!!

Reviews.Title: “Horrendous”
Reviews.Author: rubio52
Reviews.Content: We spent an awful 4 days in this dump, Claims to have 4 star, quite frankly we would not even give it that. We were sent up to a room right up in the roof area, windows would not open, it was stuffy and the air con did not work. I initially burst out laughing thinking this just could “not be our room”... went down to reception where the surly receptionist insisted it was a good as it got! I said you have to be joking, eventually after some mumbling he offered us another room which “you will not like”....... we did move to the new room (as it was larger and the windows opened) but he was very accurate “we did not like it”. The bathroom had cracked tiles on the walls, loose floor tiles, ceiling panels distorted and falling down and the sealant around the shower area, looked like it had been applied by a dog wagging its tail. I still shudder when I think about it! Breakfast, cold cooked food, coffee ok, only eaten once even though we paid for all the days. The only positive part was its position, easy walking, or access to most places we wanted to go to.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel near Barrio Gotico”
Reviews.Author: Alexnl070
Reviews.Content: Modern looking hotel near Barrio Gótico. Nice, all tough not big, clean room with a nice bathroom with bath. Free wifi internet connection.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4-star hotel”
Reviews.Author: laobringer
Reviews.Content: While it had a good location and nice staff, the room itself was NOT worthy of a 4-star rating. The bathroom floor and counter were either not clean or were stained. The towel rack was falling off. The water pressure in the shower was terrible. There was no air conditioning and even though it was December the room was so hot we couldn't sleep and couldn't even control the thermostat to turn it off. Turning it back had no effect. The room also came with free wifi but my iPad could never find the signal. The bed was uncomfortably hard. After our first night there we started looking for a different place. We moved the next day.

Reviews.Title: “very old”
Reviews.Author: lusiyildiz
Reviews.Content: We stayed at room 201 the first night.It is a terrible room which overlooks the toilets of the neighbouring houses.It is impossible to see the sky and decide if it is day or night.The windows have been tinted so as to keep the bad sight away.We were moved to room 307 which overlooks the main street,and at least we could see the sky.The elevators are slow and very old.However,breakfast was wonderful and the staff was seemed to be helpful,but could not manage much. The only good thing about the hotel was its location.Near to every faccility.This hotel should not be rated as a 4 star hotel.It can only rank 3 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Well located, nice staff, bit shabby”
Reviews.Author: oy-bell
Reviews.Content: This hotel met our needs. It was well located and clean - however, it was a bit shabby. Pros: Fridge in room 4 small bottles of water each day Free gym Very centrally located - perfect location really Free wi-fi (throughout hotel) Computers for use in lobby Lobby nicely (funkily) decorated - fresh and crisp. Safe in room. Room very quite and away from street noise - good night's sleep. Cons: Room quite small (but didn't spend a huge amount of time there) Some of the fittings and bathroom tiles were a cracked and shabby - if it was re-vamped in 2006, then a quick and poor job was done in the bathrooms. Room looked out onto wall - so little in natural light, but again, spent most of our time asleep while in the room so didn't really affect us. It shouldn't have a 4 star rating, however, it's fine and well located. There probably are a lot better 4 star hotels nearby, however, we were happy as the cost was a lot lower than the nearby options (top secret hotel offer)

Reviews.Title: “Good location for central Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: guest2302
Reviews.Content: Room was small. Air con didn't work neither did safe. Windows opaque which made the room seem like a box. Breakfast was good.

Reviews.Title: “crap hotel, not a 4star, much better hotels nearby”
Reviews.Author: Snapper8108
Reviews.Content: Put in a small, cramped room with no daylight, falling ceiling tiles and a doorframe stuffed with toilet paper. Only there for a few days and tried to change the room twice (the first time within minutes of our arrival) Promises were made but not kept. Staff unhelpfull. There are much better hotels nearby. Do not take the risk of ending up in the room we found ourselves

Reviews.Title: “this is not a 4star hotel”
Reviews.Author: will n
Reviews.Content: booked the hotel through last minute.com top secret deal.Ended up in a small cramped room with no daylight, chipped tiles, falling ceiling tiles, dirty air ducts and toilet paper packing a door frame. Not what I would expect from a four star hotel. Kept getting told that we would be moved to another room but it never materialized. There are much better hotels nearby. No wonder it was a top secret deal, they would not want people to know about this place.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Sallysara803
Reviews.Content: After seeing such mixed reviews, we were really pleased with out stay. We were on the 7th floor with fantastic views across Barcelona. We didn't visit the restaurant because we preferred to find different coffee shops to enjoy all the wonderful croissants etc, but we cannot fault the hotel. The location was just fantastic - a few minutes down to the beach and so central for the Gothic Quarter and the Ramblas. I would definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “VERY AVERAGE”
Reviews.Author: david l
Reviews.Content: this hotel is on a very busy and noisy main avenue so if booking make sure you get a room at the back as there is no double glazing. It is perfectly adequate but lacks charm - location is excelletn, jsut a stone's throw away from the cathedral

Reviews.Title: “Great location, terrible rooms”
Reviews.Author: Snapper8108
Reviews.Content: This is not a 4star hotel. We were given a room that was small,devoid of natural light and poorly fitted. The room was so small that you could hardly walk between the bed and the walls. The window looked out onto a brick wall that was only a few feet away and allowed no natural light in, which meant that we had to put a light on even in the middle of the day.There was an array of chipped tiles, falling ceiling tiles and a door that was sticking (they had tried to correct this fault by packing the doorframe out with TOILET PAPER). We had no where to sit apart from the bed (no room) and the one small desk that we had was taken over by the tv. We twice asked to be moved but despite promises by the staff, we were told that there were no other rooms available. Looking at the hotels web site, our room does not feature in the hotel images. Not surprising.The one plus that the hotel has is its location, very central which meant that we were away from the hotel as much as possible. I cannot comment on the food as we took no meals there.Barcelona is a very interesting city and if I am honest the conditions at the hotel did spoil our trip. We plan to revisit the city but shall stay well clear of the Confortel Almirante and use one of other superior 4star hotels nearby.

Reviews.Title: “great location - average hotel”
Reviews.Author: northernirelandjools
Reviews.Content: Just back from a stay at this centrally located hotel in Barcelona. I was worried beforehand by the previous reviews about the quality of the hotel but in this case I guess the old adage about getting what you pay for is true. We booked this as a secret hotel through lastminute and so felt we got a good deal - if we had paid more I may have felt differently. It is a basic hotel with small rooms (but then this is Barcelona and having stayed elsewhere in the city previously we expected this) but the big plus point is the location. It really is in the heart of the gothic quarter and to us that was what counted. We never did get the wifi working but we were able to use the hotel facilities (slow but they worked) and unlike previous reviewers we found the staff very helpful indeed. All in all we were happy with our lot despite the fact that it really isn't 4 star quality its location made up for all that - in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Lucky to be a 2* let alone a 4* hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ijan74
Reviews.Content: This hotel is nowhere near what it advertises to be! We had alarm bells ringing the moment we walked into the reception and were overcome with the smell of damp! Looking around the foyer, we could see crumbling plaster on the walls. When we went to our rooms, they were dark due to the view from the tiny window being of a brick wall! There were holes in the bathroom wall which allowed us to see into the bedroom. The theme of broken plaster continued from the foyer and corridors into the rooms and they were very small also. We complained about the room and requested a change. This was eventually agreed by the rude, arrogant staff once the rooms had been inspected by 3 staff to ensure we were not lying about our claims. There was no hint of an apology. The air conditioning in 1 of the new rooms did not work and although we reported this for 5 of the 6 nights we were there, it never got fixed as the handyman was never there to inspect it. The only good thing about the hotel was its location on Via Laietana. Its very close to all the attractions and transport. Having said that, there were a number of far superior 4* hotels yards from this one so avoid the Confortel Almirante at all costs!!

Reviews.Title: “Truly a disappointment and reception staff are rude”
Reviews.Author: Mondinat D
Reviews.Content: Positives: This hotel is centrally located and is clean. However, we chose it because it is meant to be a 4 star hotel and we were truly disappointed. First with the service, at the check-in desk the reception staff are rude, they believe they are doing you a favour. Then, you are allocated a room that is inferior to what you paid for. When you complain, they tell you is the only room available. Then after an argument, the rooms they show you had all seen seen better days. A disappointment in such a lovely city. The best thing about this hotel is the bar next door. It does not represent good value for money

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, not a 4star hotel though!”
Reviews.Author: Urky101
Reviews.Content: This hotel location is excellent, but not a 4 star though! The rooms are very small and unless you get a room at the front of the hotel, there is no natural light! The rooms are clean, but even though it was renovated in 2006, they are very shabby, cracked tiles, broken fittings, and need another overhaul! Taking all that into account, I was happy as we didnt pay loads, and the location made up for decor, and you only sleep in the room!

Reviews.Title: “Shouldn't be a 4 star- get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: Kateandmaxie
Reviews.Content: No way near a four star standard; basic rooms that resemble a uk premier inn. If you want a taste of luxury, or a hotel to spend any time in.... This isn't the one for you. However if you want a cheapish hotel to sleep, within easy reach of la gambla then this is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant central location - highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: Charlottedanaher
Reviews.Content: This hotel is clean, friendly, and centrally located. Easy walk to beach, on the doorstep of Gothic / Jaume / Born areas - which are lovely for dinner and drinks. We saw a couple of the rooms and some of the doubles can be small but you can ask to change to a twin and they will give you a bigger room. Can't fault the staff, clenliness or location.

Reviews.Title: “horrid hostel style hotel”
Reviews.Author: jordybirdwales
Reviews.Content: dingy dark paint peeling rooms , beds with no headboards , sullen reception staff no wonder , I expect everyone complains , this place is realy bad , my husand and I plus our two teenage daughters booked in here today sadly we have paid for four nights upfront , this is our third trip to Barcelona this hotel was the most we have paid and is by far the worst this is not a four or even three star hotel , we feel cheated by the description and want to warn others , location is very good but thats where it ends , staff so unhelpfull we asked for rooms close together we are two floors away , corridors very dark and dismal lift so delapedated afraid to use it , we have asked for even half our money back so that we could relocate , but no chance , forgot to mention airconditioner doesnt work and fridge like everything else in this room is broken , we have four nights here ,, wish us luck ..

Reviews.Title: “It is not even up to 3 stars hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ayman_Moamen
Reviews.Content: Too small room and missing allot of things, No any kind of the entertainment available, I didn't enjoy my stay there, for me it was just a place to sleep!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, recommended as a central base”
Reviews.Author: CandNIreland
Reviews.Content: Clean, quiet hotel, very central in excellent location (Gothic area of Barcelona). Good buffet breakfast to get you started. Good choice of carparking close to hotel. Our rooms overlooked the Via Laietana. Hotel is within easy walking distance from all main attractions. Also easy access in and out of the city by car. We will be back. Colette, Nigel & family, Ireland.

Reviews.Title: “Basking in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: taxidiataltys
Reviews.Content: Unbeatable central location, very friendly staff and cool modern decor. You can't go wrong staying at this Confortel!!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, clean and very central, within walking distance of the metro, marina, aquarium and shopping areas.”
Reviews.Author: ACB35
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our trip to Barcelona and our stay at the hotel. My only complaint is that I had made a reservation online and ordered fruit baskets and a bottle of sparkling wine as it was our anniversary, but even though I requested the wine three times at the hotel, it never came. Otherwise very friendly staff, clean rooms, some of which need refurbishment especially the triple room. Would go again if only for the price and location.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Noofo
Reviews.Content: Hotel was good with typical small european rooms. Rooms and hotel were very clean. Located near the cathedral and Gothic area it is a great location. Fitness room is good for a light workout. Free water in minibar everyday is great. Internet was very slow, but staff very helpful with any queries.

Reviews.Title: “Simplistic nice place without customer service”
Reviews.Author: granitegal1975
Reviews.Content: This was not what I expected, but it was decent. I did not however enjoy paying for a hotel and then not receiving all that was promised. Our air conditioner did not work. I had two rooms and neither room worked. Once I told the front desk, they told me that I didn't shut the window. Well, In one room ok, but the other room- the window was off track and they never got it back on track. We stayed there two days too long. I was offered the last day to move.... two floors away from my teenager. I don't think so. They were not apologetic at all. We only really had to deal with it at night, and it was luckily bearable somewhat but what about the real summertime! Save your money and go somewhere else or check the air first!

Reviews.Title: “Poor hotel at a nice location”
Reviews.Author: Kpanagop
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 5 nights and I wouldn't say that I would stay there again. The location was nice as it was central and in the Gothic part of the city, however, the rooms were too noisy, especially at the front side of the hotel. Apart from that in the fist room that I was given there was no heating and it took a couple of hours before I am taken to another room. Also the room size is small and there was no smoking room with a double bed.

Reviews.Title: “Chill out, it's not that bad!”
Reviews.Author: Kylokylokylo
Reviews.Content: We had a few cracked tiles in the bathroom and the towel rail was a bit loose, the tv was old and the air con didn't appear to do anything. HOWEVER! Really nice staff who let me charge my phone at the front desk, room temperature was fine, the street is noisy during the day as is every street in the world, quieter at night. We were on the third floor and it was fine. Great shower too. My only real issue was that the curtains were very thin, so it was very bright in the morning. Why people get so upset over a cracked tile I just don't know. Admittedly it's not 4*, more like three but get over it!

Reviews.Title: “GOOD”
Reviews.Author: florinsandu
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in 2009 , and i can say that the hotel was very good. We booked it through hotelcon, and we received a very good price per night. The room was large, 5th floored, a huge bathroom, clean, all in all very good to my standards. The breakfast was sufficient, diverse, even wine was in the morning, beside salads, cheese, ham, jamon, etc...breakfast was very good. As for location, what can i say more about, considering that iti is in the heart of Barcelona....very close to the metro and plaza Catalunya.....very central (and trust me, becasue i have visited Barcelona 3 times, it is my soul city). Chose it with no strings atached!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: PAUL-1512
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights, friendly staff, room on the small side but then city centre hotel and only sleeping so not a problem. Good range of food for breakfast and reasonably priced for city centre, All in all, a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms were terrible - not a 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: pinewood1
Reviews.Content: After our dissappointment with our room which was very small and badly laid out with cracked tiles, we asked to move to another room, no problem with this but the room was a smoking room so was shown another room. We took this as we did not want to spend our time transfering from one room to another but this room has cracked and broken floor tiles especially in the bathroom, we had to put the bath mat and a towel on the floor so that we did not cut our feet. Bothe basins had cracks in them and one somebody had tried to make a repair. The shower leaked, the toilet moved. The linings of the curtains were torn and hanging down. Wall tiles had been replaced but with a different colour. The foyer of the hotel was fine very clean and smart but them we were not sitting or sleeping in there. Staff were trying to be helpful. The hotel is in need of some desperate work carried out on it as a lot of these problems obviously they knew about but had not addressed them. Otherwise Barcelona was great.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely not a 4 star hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Mursh
Reviews.Content: We took a chance because the reviews seemed to indicate that the hotel would be fine for our purposes. On the positive side we got a good impression at Reception. Looks chic and staff were friendly & helpful. The hotel is in an excellent position for investigating Barcelona. The bedroom was big enough for two, the beds were comfortable and the mini fridge was constantly stocked with free water. And then............. The air conditioning was ineffective, the fridge was ineffective, the window looked onto 40foot high walls and over the hotel kitchen's huge extractor fans. There was no air and lots of noise but I suppose someone has to sleep at the back of the hotel. The bathroom was disgusting. Water damage everywhere. Dirty sealant around the bath & tiles. The shower rail was hanging off the wall. The floor tiles were mismatched where they had been replaced. Those that hadn't been replaced were cracked and chipped. (No bare feet in that bathroom) Cracked toilet bowl and holes in the wall where the toilet roll holder used to be. The enamel was peeling from the inside of the bath. I can't imagine how this hotel can be 4* and I'm pleased that we didn't have to spend too much time there. We didn't pay an exorbitant price but any price is too much for a room like that. How much does it cost to ensure that a bathroom is maintained at a reasonable, hygenic and safe standard?

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but more like a 3 star.”
Reviews.Author: 1girlintheworld
Reviews.Content: The location is prime for exploring. The staff we interacted with were friendly and helpful. Loved that they had free bottles of ice cold water in the mini bar. The rooms are a tight squeeze even by European standards. We literally couldn't walk around the bed and had to climb over. But, hey you're in Barcelona so you don't spend any time in the room except to sleep, right? That was where we had the real issue. I'm sure interior rooms are quieter, but if you face the street you may as well drag your bed onto the sidewalk. Street noise was unbearable. We've been traveling in Europe for 4 months and staying at 4 star hotels. This hotel definitely didn't measure up. I think the value for the location is the only reason to choose this hotel. BTW- While waiting in line to speak to the front desk 2 guys in front of us were explaining how there room had been robbed the night before. The front desk person admitted that it had happened with one other room as well. The guys were very calm, especially considering over 800 Euro and all their watches and electronics had been stolen. The front desk person just nonchalantly told them to go file a police report. I would have been furious at his lack of concern. So be sure to lock up all valuables when staying here!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Room, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: LMD01
Reviews.Content: After reading many of the bad reviews on Trip Advisor, I was nervous about what we might end up with by staying in this hotel however we had an extremely pleasant stay. We arrived after midnight and Nerji on the desk was very friendly and most helpful. We had a room on the top floor (8th floor) overlooking El Barri Gotic. This room had a lovely balcony with seating for the evening time. Location wise, this street Via Laietana is perfect as we did not like the Rambla area and we were away from the nightlife. It is a pleasant five minute walk to the Rambla through traditional streets. It is about a mile walk to Barceloneta Beach. We did not experience any street noise at night however I would point out that the walls for each room are a little thin. Breakfast gives a nice range of pastries, two cereals and various other meats. This is perfect to get the day started. It is a little over priced however we had a cheap rate that included breakfast. The hotel is close to the metro stop Juaime which is where all the really nice and traditional restaurants are. A hidden gem at that. I would have no problem recommending this hotel. For those who complain about tv channels, and small rooms etc, Barcelona is a city break. All you want is a decent room to sleep! Clean and modern is what we got. We didn't use the tv once as we went away to see the City, not watch tv. We were provided with fresh towels and toiletries every day. Thank you Confortel Almirante!

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: Irishms
Reviews.Content: This hotel is conveniently located to the cathedral and old town centre. It is literally a three minute walk from the hotel. Our room was clean and very spacious. The bathroom was clean and the shower was powerful. The computers in the reception area were very helpful for planning the rest of our journey. We checked out at 5.30 a.m. and the receptionist could not have been more helpful at that time in the morning. Would definitely return to this hotel if in Barcelona again!

Reviews.Title: “Four Star + renovated????”
Reviews.Author: TonyIreland54
Reviews.Content: Was supposedly 4 Star and renovated - loose tiles on the floor of our bedroom, very old style TV with limited international channels - staff friendly and good breakfast with a good central location. In a 4 Star I would expect a little more in the toiletry line other than schampoo and bubble bath; we had to ask for schampoo on the last night. A frayed towel in the bathroom added tol the general not well organised feel! Next time we will stay in a 2 or 3 star - the rooms will proably be no better but cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “FIND ANOTHER HOTEL TO STAY IN”
Reviews.Author: mr999
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not 4 stars, it looks modern but the rooms are dirty, dusty. The beds and pillows are very uncomfortable. The only plus is the location but I am sure you can find better hotels. Breakfast is ok but nothing spectacular, coffee is horrible. Elevators are slow and very small, takes forever. Airconditioning is very weak.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value”
Reviews.Author: ron4sc
Reviews.Content: I'm also surprised by the negative reviews. We stayed there for three nights at the end of July. When we booked the reservation, we told them that we had two children and wanted adjoining rooms with a door between them so we could walk between the two rooms. Unfortunately, they didn't provide that but we did have two rooms next to each other so that was appreciated. Positives: The location was fantastic. It was in between two metro stops that were easy to get to. As an aside, definitely use Barcelona's EXCELLENT subway system to get around the city. The hotel is right across the street from the cathedral and about a half mile from Las Ramblas. We either walked from our hotel or caught the subway everywhere. This saved a lot of money in cabs and we got to really experience the charm of Barcelona. The hotel also had a nice design. It looked like a W Hotel that wasn't trying to look and sound so hip...if you know what I mean. I also appreciated the free wifi which allowed me to download music and podcast to my iphone. :) The only negatives about the hotel are what we would consider the thin walls. We could here the family in the next room when they came in and when they were making a lot of noise. Is it the Ritz Carlton? No, but we thought it was an excellent value, clean and had friendly people working there. Hard to beat the price and location.

Reviews.Title: “we were really scared after reading some of the reviews..”
Reviews.Author: LuskaHyzka
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel for 3 nights. After reading some of the reviews we didnt think a lot of the hotel but I must stay we were really surprised - in a good way. 1/ friendliness of the staff. We met 3 different receptionists - all of them friendly and helpful. Actually - after my fiancé had been stolen his ID on the street after he checked out of the hotel, he returned there (as it wasnt far from the hotel) to sort out all the phonecalls in a quiet environment. They printed out all what he needed, advised him where to go to the police, etc. Although at some point the reception got very busy and there was always just one receptionist, we never found them unfriendly or rude. 2/ not enough choice at the breakfast - cornflakes, fruits, meat, chicken, eggs, sausages, bacon, croissants, muffins, cheese. The only thing I missed was the fresh vegetable but definitely - the choice is huge. 3/ small rooms and a bad view - our room was spacious and had a good view. But I suppose, as the hotel is attached between 2 buildings, some of the rooms might have a bad view. Our room also had a terrace - amazing and relaxing to sit there in the afternoon. The noise is there as Via Laietana is the main street but the room was totally quiet once we closed the terrace door (and also not too noisy when sitting on the terrace). 4/ slow lifts - this is what I agree with but we never waited longer than couple of minutes. Generally I must say we liked the hotel a lot. Our room was cleaned every day, they changed our sheets and towels daily, too (I actually missed the sign "if you want us to change your towels today, leave them in the bath tub" to be friendlier to our environment). It is very central, most of the sightseeing we did by walking, internet is for free (well, very nice surprise because it is still not usual even in the 4* hotels), there is the safe in the room, too. I definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Just not worth it”
Reviews.Author: Dharmaboy17
Reviews.Content: This place is gloomy and overpriced. The service is sloppy and the rooms look uncared for: deep gashes in the walls, bare plaster filling holes in the bathroom, grouting missing from between the tiles, a broken TV remote kept together with tape, etc. It would be fine were this a 2-3 star hotel with prices to match. But this place has 4 star pretensions and high prices. I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “DEFINETELY NOT A 4-STAR HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: olga2003
Reviews.Content: The only good thing about this hotel is the location. There is no manager to run it, the only persons we met were the reception personnel. We had booked for a 3 bed room directly through the hotel chain site. The reservation was made well in advance. Upon our arrival (two adults and one child) we were offered to stay in a room with bathroom suitable for people with reduced mobility (wheeling chair instead of bathtub ! higher toilet than normal – our child is 7 ! years old). Of course we requested for a normal room with a normal bathroom utilities. We ended up in a room being very narrow very dirty and with most ground tiles to be broken. We requested for another change and we ended at room with a window covered by a sticky white paper for not allowing the view to other people’s balconies. The air conditioning was not working and as there was no other way to refresh the room we kept the window open. Since we were tired and our kid needed to be fed we chose to stay in good faith. We have to mention that we were seeing the rooms ourselves, no one was guiding us – the receptionist who had no idea what the rooms really look like, was at the reception and the front office manager was busy while promoting the hotel to some agency – we had already bought our accommodation, so there was no need to take care of us. Coming back at night, around 10 pm to rest we discovered that was impossible to sleep since there was a loud noise from the adjacent restaurant (as told later on from the hotel personnel during the night hours) that kept us up until 4:00 am. The noise form the adjacent restaurant was so loud (the window glass was thin, no sound proof) that we thought we were in a middle of a teenager’s party. We went down stairs and asked for the hotel personnel to come in to the room and verify the noise, as he did, in order to inform directly the hotel management of the situation. Unfortunately the hotel manager never showed up (and was always unreachable) and instead we were treated by the hotel reception (the morning shift) as that noise was normal, not to mention the dirtiness (I was so furious that I did not think to take pictures of all that. Finally we managed to be moved to the other hotel of the same hotel chain, the Confortel Barcelona at the other end of the town. This hotel, from the reception personnel to the accommodation, was excellent and up to the expected standards. We sent all these comments by e-mail to the central reservation of the hotel asking at least for compensation , but no one really bothered to answer back.

Reviews.Title: “Not 4 Star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Geri210161
Reviews.Content: The entrance looks like a design hotel. But the design doesn't follow function. The personal isn't friendly. They are slow. The room service forgot to put new towels, after taking off the old ones. Which isn't that big problem , if they could solve it friendly at the desk. They gave us the towels to bring them up. Its more a hostel than a 4* hotel . Breakfast buffet was empty at ten. The good thing is: you leave the hotel for the wonderful BArcelona. Its between the gothic quarter and the Borne quarter. Perfect for shopping and looking for restaurants. If you don't expect a 4* hotel it's ok.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely not a 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: athensfan
Reviews.Content: I was on a business trip and spent there almost a week. good things are the location (in the center of BCN) and the breakfast that was fine as well. bad things are the rooms that are small and some of them don't have a desk (no place to work with a laptop), the doors on the balcony that do not close properly as a result you can hear noise from the busy street below, the wi-fi connection that on one hand is free but on the other it dropped off quite often and was slow (definitely not good for business travelers) and the walls of the rooms that have to be repainted as marks from shoes and suitcases can be seen. I would say that if you get a good price go for it, if not better try elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great service”
Reviews.Author: Gwarrior
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Confortel Almirante between Christmas and New Year. We have visited Barcelona numerous times and this was our second stay at this particular hotel. As a base for exploring Barcelona I think that this hotel is great for the price. It is walking distance to Cataluña Square, La Rambla and the Gothic Quarter. It is close to a Metro station and then just three Metro stops away from the sea food and casino at Port Olympic. When we are on a city break, all we need is a clean bed with a cup of coffee and a croissant in the morning. I certainly don't want a noisy hotel bar at night or a full hit fry-up in the morning! If you do want a bar, there is a particularly fine tapas bar literally next door to the hotel which is far superior to any hotel bar and is full of local people. I feel that I must mention the high level of service that we received particularly given some of the earlier negative comments that have been posted. We arrived quite late at night and there was only one man at the desk. Despite him being on his own after checking in and going to our room I telephoned him about the safe in the room and he brought the key up and then helped me hook up the hotel's free WIFI for my iPhone (I didn't want to miss the cricket score in the morning!). On the day of departure I asked if the hotel internet room had a printer and was advised that it did not. I explained that I wished to check in at the airport on-line and print off my boarding card to avoid check in queues. The young lady on reception very kindly gave me access to the hotel computer in the office together with a printer. All in all we had a very pleasant experience at this hotel for a second time and would not hesitate to use this hotel on a future trip.

Reviews.Title: “A super friendly hotel in a great location, ideal for weekend sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: lynb0
Reviews.Content: Please do not let the other reviews put you off. We had a great deal for this hotel with "1800" hotels, only paid £100 for two nights with breakfast included. Yes, this hotel is really a three star but our room (502) was clean, comfy beds, large powerful shower, everything you need for a weekend break. We were pleased we were at the back of the hotel as the rooms at the front would be noisy. It meant we could open the window at night and get some fresh air. Yes there is an apartment block at the back, but hey this is Barcelona! Unless you have booked a hotel next to Cuitadella park all the hotels will have similar views! (were they expecting herds of migrating wilderbeast!!) Sorry, couldnt resist that one. The reception staff were very friendly and the lady who served coffee was also lovely, you just had to ask if you wanted more or help yourself. There are two lifts, call both of them if you dont want to wait, having said that, we never waited along time. The hotel has a luggage store. It is 2-3 mins from "jaume I" Metro and 7 mins. walk from Catalunya Square. The breakfast is typical of 3 star City hotels in Spain. Lots of pastries, plenty of bacon but eggs a little over cooked. PS We are discerning travellers who have stayed in lots of hotels, villas and apartments. This hotel is not for someone looking for the "Hotel Experience" it is for those wanting to get out and about and "do" Barcelona, knowing that a centrally located hotel with a comfy bed and good breakfast awaits! ENJOY

Reviews.Title: “Know what you get into”
Reviews.Author: Mobile_Eye
Reviews.Content: Before my trip I read the reviews and I was kind of curious why they were so varied. After the trip I can understand some of it. This hotel is really a mixed bag. The view from the room was just bad, floor tiles in the bathroom very breaking down, there were no bathrobes, the TV remote was fixed with tape, one of the elevators was quite old etc. But the location is excellent, room was clean, staff is friendly and efficient, hotel location is excellent, breakfast was tasty and there are many nice ideas all around the hotel. All in all this is no different from similar hotels in France, England and Italy. No luxury but if you can deal with the bad points the good points are good and your stay will be enjoyable. Just don't expect Japanese or Nordic quality.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Becky006
Reviews.Content: This was a decent hotel in a busy, central part of barcelona. Breakfast is until 10.30 and the rooms are quiet and air-conditioned. The bathroom had lots of natural light, but could have done with freshen up in the paint / sealant department. Its next to the gothic quarter and you can be wandering around the tiny streets in about 3 minutes. We found a great tapas bar called ' Taller de Tapas' just down the road, and a small organic supermarket where we bought our bottled water - 33c compared to 2 euros from a street vendor. I'd stay again, It was around 25 - 30 euros from the airport (Fiu)

Reviews.Title: “This is not a 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Droghedacon
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here 4 5 nights and to say this hotel is a shambles is an understatement. The rooms are not up to 4 star standard and the view from are window consisted of looking at laundry hanging from the balcony's of a rundown apartment block not ten yards away.I immediatly complained about this and was shown another room which was actually worse, so we had to make do with the room we had with the broken toilet seat,broken toilet roll holder,broken toilet door handle,broken tiles etc etc ... The receptionist/manager was so rude,sarcastic and no way obliging.Her manner was that poor i demanded a refund which she said i could have so i went to find another hotel and after trying a few i eventually found a real 4 star hotel a few minutes away.After returning to pack our bags and get our refund she then told me sneeringly she couldn't do it.No bar,no restauraunt and breakfast was awful.Apart from this Barcelona is a wonderful city and we did not let this experience spoil it for us.

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel with quiet rooms in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: soprano20
Reviews.Content: Just had a brilliant weekend in Barcelona with my boyfriend, made all the better for our great stay at Confortel Almirante. Situated right between the Barri Gotic and the Born/St Pere area you are within 5 minutes walk of countless great breakfast options, restaurants and bars and walking distance to the beach, cathedral, Las Ramblas, Casa Milla, Palau de Musica etc. Buses stop outside the front door and metro stop very close by. Despite being in the centre of town and on a main transit route through the city, our large spacious room at the back of the hotel was incredibly peaceful. Reception staff were helpful and polite, and free internet terminals were useful when reluctantly arranging transport home. The reception area looks very cool, however the rooms were a little tried in places with some rogue chipped tiles, marked walls which could really do with a bit of a touch up. All in all, a perfect place to dump bags, crash for the night and enjoy the sights of Bercelona

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: kathybeeMelbourne
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location with friendly, helpful staff. Buffet breakfast fresh & tasty. Would stay again & recommend to all. Kathy Australia.

Reviews.Title: “More like a hostel than a four star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Edina
Reviews.Content: If you want a four star hotel find somewhere else. No restaurant (other than breakfast buffet), No bar, No tea/coffee facilities, mini bar in room stocked only with bottled water, room service provided by the local pizza delivery! The main lobby looks very fresh and contemporary, it masks what are basic, dated and grubby rooms. We had a superior room with terrace on the 8th floor, as other reviewers have commented, the floor was swept but not washed there were 'dried spots' and around the toilet was an odour of stale urine, the sink was blocked, the shower was a hand held over a flimsy bath tub, the tiles were stained and had mildew on them. The water pressure and temperature varied considerably and was dependent on how many other people in the hotel had the taps turned on. The beds were cheap hard mattresses with blankets!! The pillows lumpy and underneath the cover hideously stained. The fitness center was basic and in a small stuffy room. On the plus side, the sheets were changed daily, the air-conditioning was quiet and effective and the double glazing helped in cutting the road traffic noise. The location was good. Of a standard you would expect of a higher end hostel or two star hotel. I have no idea how this place got a four star rating.

Reviews.Title: “Really Nice Hotel, Superb Location, Great Value”
Reviews.Author: JohnJoeRambo
Reviews.Content: Staff are friendly and check-in was quick, hotel is very well maintained and is very stylish The breakfast buffest is nice and you get the usual stuff. The location of this hotel is excellent, short walk in each direction and you are at the marina, Gaudi's Cathedral, Gothic Quarters and Las Ramblas. Overall this hotel is great value for money and I would be staying here again if ever in Barcelona again.

Reviews.Title: “Great base for sight seeing!”
Reviews.Author: dsgillon
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights and we were more than happy with the accommodation, after all you are out most of the day sight seeing so to us it was a great base, the location couldn't have been better. Within easy walking distance of the metro, Ramblas and the old cathedral, some lovely restaurants and bars. Our room was looking over the main street and we thought it may be noisy at night time but it was fine. The room was clean and made up each morning, fresh towels were also replaced daily. The breakfast was very nice lots to choose from, lovely scrambled eggs and bacon! please don't let some of the other reviews put you off, it was a very nice hotel - not the ritz or the hilton but a great base for doing all the fantastic sights of Barcelona which, when all said done is what you are there for - I would definitely stay here again and recommend the hotel to friends for a short city break.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to par”
Reviews.Author: Lorejoyce
Reviews.Content: Finishing up a fabulous cruise with a few days in Barcelona. We chose this hotel after a recommendation from a friend. The lobby and public areas were nice and modern. Our room wasn't ready due to our early arrival, but the front desk stored our luggage while we toured the city. Around noon we returned and were told that only a room with two beds would be available. We didn't realize it was two single beds, pushed together. The front desk clerk said that was the best room in the hotel. Seriously. We had a room with dripping faucets, a tv that didn't work, mattresses that had springs coming through, scratchy sheets, hard/flat pillows and absolutely no privacy. We felt like we were in a hostel. Or as my husband describes the feeling of being in a tomb. The bathroom floor was swept clean but had dried "spots" on the floor so it obviously wasn't washed - I kept my slippers on the entire time. Our bed was barely made the next day, just sheets thrown over and by the next morning my husband was sleeping in his twin bed on a bare mattress. We were laughing at how sad it actually was. Since other reviewers were so positive, there must be a vast difference in rooms, or our quality expectations are vastly different. We could hear people having a party next door at 4:00 am, like they were in our room. We could hear people's conversations in the hallway, every door that slammed, every toilet flushing. It was completely ridiculous. On the other hand, if you don't care about the rooms or getting any sleep, the location is great and breakfast is included. Oh, and don't forget to bring your own washcloths - like many European hotels, this one doesn't have them.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for the location”
Reviews.Author: Elaine009
Reviews.Content: My group stayed 3 days at Confortel before a cruise on RCL. My party consisted of 5 - a family of 3 and myself, I am disabled and a friend. Confortel had an adaptive room for two that was excellent. Our rooms were an excellent price at 120 euros including breakfast. The breakfast alone is valued at 20 euros. Our hotel experience consisted of: - Large rooms by european standards and a family hotel room with three beds.. - Free internet. - Walking distance to Picasso museum, the Bishops Cathedral, The Conservatory of Music, Opera house, the on/off bus, and Las Ramblas - Gothic area so there are plenty side streets with easy access and shopping - Two male desk clerks were fantastic. There was a woman at the desk one day that was challenging but we overcame it. - We all got a free breakfast, daily, with our reservation which i highly recommend. It was buffet style with about 40 choices. - Plenty of cafes and restaurants near. We asked for an english menu which was helpful. Try the Tapas as they are inexpensive, filling and delicious. I had the blood sausage Tapas which was out of this world.

Reviews.Title: “Confortel Almirante - Great stay for the value”
Reviews.Author: mparker
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from traveling in Barcelona after a Met. Cruise with NCL. The Confortel was a great hotel with a boutique design that we enjoyed very much. Advantages/Disadvantages: - Rooms are good size with a view if you are on the 6th or 7th floor. - Rooms have modern decor, very clean, and large bathrooms - Internet is free during your stay (if you bring your laptop, you have free access). There are only two computers available on the first floor. However, they was never anyone waiting when we were there. - Very close to other sites, within walking distance to Las Ramblas and other historic sites - Gothic area so there are plenty side streets with easy access and shopping - Desk clerks very helpful - The breakfast is a bit pricey if you dine after 7:00 a.m., be sure to ask at the front desk before signing up - Plenty of eating cafes close by - On and off bus stop within a short walk near the hotel. This made it very easy to navigate around the city - Unless you speak Spanish or Catalan, you will most likely need to investigate the cost of restaurant prices before dining. A small pizza at an area eatery cost us $60. and we only had water and a soft drink with it. - Beware of taxi cab drivers in this city as they sometimes take advantage of tourists. We were overcharged many times.

Reviews.Title: “Maybe we got lucky but our room was fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: mswhoeveryouare
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel on last minute and was a little wary of the mixed reviews but we had a fantastic room and amazing view of the city. We arrived at about noon and rooms weren't ready so we left our case and wandered for a couple of hours. When we got back we were asked if we wanted smoking or non and i said we didn't mind just the nicest room. We were given a non smoking room on the 8th floor (top) at the back of the hotel with a balcony (which had an ashtray, so partly smoking) looking out across the city. I think because we were so high and at the back of the hotel the noise was better than for people lower down or at the front - but we are light sleepers and we didn't have any problems. The room was huge with a nice clean modern shower room - perfect for us but if you want to have a bath it may be worth requesting one. Also decent hairdryer - one with a bit of puff - which you don't always get! we had a mini bar stocked with bottles of free water and a TV. The location is great, nice area no concerns about walking around and very close to the action. The staff were really friendly and the buffet breakfast was great a whole range for bacon and scrambled eggs to cereal, fruit, bread, cheese, sweet pastries what more can you want. I guess the reason i haven given it 5 is that i think a lot of people like the full extras - there were no tea of coffee facilities, no iron (but i am sure you could ask for one) toiletries were average, no bar, room service was a basically a pizza menu and you would prob get better/cheeper from dominoes a couple of doors down BUT we loved it spotless bathroom, towels and bedding, lush view, spacious room and yummy breakfast - wish i could have stayed longer

Reviews.Title: “Miserable Reception Marred our trip”
Reviews.Author: dor9
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at this hotel we were told in a very rude manner that we were going to be taken to another hotel in a very poor location of Barcelona. When I refused this, saying it was uneceptable, after minutes we were given, a nice but very small room. Throughout our short stay this particular receptionist would not reply to our hellos and goodbyes and had very poor social skills! he made us fill uncomfortable for not just rolling over and agreeing to a hotel that wasn't suitable which, although we did enjoy ourselves, tarnished our trip getting us of to a bad start.

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel in the perfect tourist location”
Reviews.Author: Marymoll
Reviews.Content: My mother and I stayed in this hotel recently. It was perfect for what we needed - somewhere central and reasonably upmarket without breaking the bank. We got more than expected for the price paid on 1800hotels - lovely breakfast, great room with two double beds, nice view from our balcony, central location that couldn't have had us better placed for hitting the tourist and shopping spots (whilst not being on a noisy street). Water in the mini bar was complimentary, but nothing else available, so stock up on snacks / other drinks in the shop a few doors down. Hop on / hop off bus stops a few metres down the road from the hotel and a short walk down to the beach / marina. It doesn't advertise it in many websites, but there is also a small gym in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: DandMNewcastleonTyne
Reviews.Content: Could not fault this hotel.Staff were pleasant and helpful.Room was spotless And what an excellent location. Only problem we had was the advert for a free mini-bar,the only thing it was full of was bottles of water,but that's being a bit picky. I would defineatly reccommend ths hotel

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, perfect for a city break”
Reviews.Author: danbrooks
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a weekend break at the hotel, the location was excellent and the view from the window was out of this world. Just outside the hotel door is a bus stop and taxi pick up point and the metro stop Jaume about a five minutes walk. The hotel has free internet access, the service that we received from the receptionists was perfect for English speeking travellers. A really modern decor on the inside and a perfectly historic look from the main road. If you are expecting huge rooms then you will not be happy, but why do you want a huge room for a city break. The camp Nou is an absolute must and the bus turistic guides are not to be missed.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the view”
Reviews.Author: Joe_Hull
Reviews.Content: Having arrived in Barcelona after a week in a tent at a music festival, the hotel was an amazing. I had e-mailed before I arrived to ask for a high up room as the vacation was a 21'st present for my girlfriend, we were given a room on the top floor with a balcony, What a view!!!! we could see the cathedral from our room. It was a large room, huge bathroom, with plenty of space and the free mini bar was a relief being full of coke/ water. The hotel staff are extremely helpful, always smiling and bent over backwards for us, the internet room is very small with 2 computers but your not on vacation to check e-mails! Only 2 complaints, they gave us 2 double beds next to each other rather than one bed like we asked for but we didnt complain as we just enjoyed the space and make a huge bed instead, and the walls and edges on the windows were cracking or falling apart, which looks a bit shabby. apart from that I have no complaints, its right in the centre of the city and being on the top floor like we were, when you close your doors, theres no noise at all. would definatly recommend if you want a hotel for a few nights.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, if you get the right room.”
Reviews.Author: Matrus
Reviews.Content: Having read some of the previous reviews I really wasn't sure what to expect of this hotel. We stayed here for 4 nights (Mon-Fri). We didn't arrive until just before midnight on the first evening, but we we found the staff to be very polite and welcoming when we checked in. We had requested a non smoking room with a balcony, well we got the balcony, but it was definitelty a smoking room. We rang down to reception and politely asked if it would be possible to move to a non-smking room, we were told this should be fine but would have to wait until the morning, so we spent the first night in the room. The original room was on the second floor and at the front of the building, very, very noisy! I don't normally complain about road noise, we were in the centre of the city after all, however, as it was so hot you really needed to have the doors open. In the morning we were moved to a non-smoking room at the back of the hotel, no balcony but that didn't really matter as the room was fresh and very quiet, a vast improvement. Nice large bathroom with double basin and bath/shower and very clean. If you plan to stay at this hotel I would suggest you ask for a room on the 5th floor as it's completely non-smoking and specify a room at the rear of the hotel if you want to avoid the noise, clearly the downside to this is that you wont have a view, but then when you're in a city like Barcelona the hotels only really a bed for the night, you'll be sightseeing all day anyway! In summary we were very pleased with this hotel, and its staff, and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nightmare”
Reviews.Author: LadyLucy08
Reviews.Content: Arrived 12th april 2008. Small room with very hard matress and pillows. Advised on check in that breakfast was included. Had to pay €17 for poor breakfast. Found staff unhelpful and rude. The cleaning staff stard at 7am in this hotel, Whilst carrying out their duties they make noise. We couldn't sleep due to the noise level. The cleaning staff come in to your room even though you have a do not disturb sign. Found the nnoise level unacceptable once cleaning staff begin their duties. They had no consideration for guests trying to rest. I would not recomend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay for the price”
Reviews.Author: TracyJerram
Reviews.Content: My friend and I were a little worried reading some of the previous reviews, but thought for £152 including flights for 3 nights, we couldnt moan. So glad we booked into this fab little hotel. We did as other reviewers suggested, asked at booking for a non-smoking room, with a street view on the top floor. What we got was a very large clean, bright room, with great ensuite facility. Mini bar which was FREE and restocked daily. The staff were superb and extremely helpful. We purchased our bus tour tickets via the reception and the bus tour stops directly outside. The hotel is extremely well placed for the gothic quarter (just cross the road and you're there), close to the bus stop from the airport, close proximity to Las Ramblas and waterfront. We ordered pizzas in one night and the reception staff made all the phone calls for us. We took a kettle, coffee, mugs etc and they gave us a jug of milk for our fridge. No it's not a 4* but what on earth do you expect for this kind of money. The only thing that was a problem was the noise for the road. The hotel sits on the main thoroughfare from to the waterfront and runs parallel to Las Ramblas. The traffic noise NEVER stops so there is no way you can sleep with the window open. There are some great cafes and restaurants on your doorstop. We didn't choose to have breakfast at the hotel, but at the cafe next door at half the price. Check out was at 12:00midday, what more could you ask for. Great for anyone wanting a cheap break and not for those who are used to luxury.

Reviews.Title: “Awful Staff”
Reviews.Author: jen1888
Reviews.Content: Had booked in December to stay in this hotel for 2 nights in March. Emailed hotel beforehand to let them know what time we were arriving. When we arrived at the hotel at around midnight we were informed that there was a problem with our room and we were being sent to another hotel for the night. Was not happy with this at all but we went to the other hotel (Hotel Gotico) anyway. We were told to report back to the Confortel Almirante to speak to the manager the following morning which we did. Unfortunately we did not get to speak to the manager just some surly employees who were no help whatsoever. They just kept asking us what the problem was. We did not get even one apology they just did not care. I would not advise anyone to book this hotel and if you already have then please call ahead to confirm your booking. We emailed and got a reply yet still didn't get our room.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lionelmessy
Reviews.Content: Some of the services Confortel Almirante offers: - Small rooms that were decorated around about the turn of the last century. - Showers with absolutely no pressure, although hotel staff will kindly send someone along to look at it for you and do nothing about it. - Air conditioning that blows hot air only, which means you have to keep the windows open, allowing all the noise in from the outside. - Blinds that don't close - Hotel staff that open your private mail for you. - Cleaning staff that enjoy a good natter every morning, outside your door. - No room service In short, possibly the worst 4*hotel in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: adrianro
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated in a great place, close to the Rambla, Gotic City and close to Plaza Catalunya. You're close to verything, right in the city's center! The rooms are ok, the bathroom a little small but it's ok. The minibar is free (mineral water, Coke, Soda water and Beer) and it's the first hotel that I received this service! The hotel breakfast was great! I was before in another 4 stars hotel in Barcelona and the breakfast there was very poor. The people are very nice, expecially if you speak spanish. I won't repeat everything that is already told by other reviewers, but the bottom line is that the hotel is ok and I'll recommend it to my friends/family.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: BillyWales
Reviews.Content: having booked hotel through local agent for trip to Barcelona i was a little concerned by some of the reviews i found on the site which gave it poor reviews. I took the advice that was offered by some previous postings and contacted the hotel by e-mail directly before our arrival. I requested a non smoking room on a high floor with if possible a view. I have to say we were well rewarded as we were located in room 802 which was a nice room reasonably spacious with a balcony which was on the corner of the hotel frontage, top floor and had great views of the city both up and down via laiteana. the hotel was in a great location for exploring the city minutes from La Rambla, Placa de la Catalunya, the main cathedral etc. breakfast in the hotel was included in the stay and was a good way to set yourself up for the day. the room also had a small fridge with drinks provided free of charge. All i can say is that despite some poor reviews on this site we found this a good clean hotel with friendly staff in a great location. one final tip would be the bus touristic, which is the standard fare but over a two day period provided us with a great way to see the sights of the city and was a lot better value than its conterpart in London.

Reviews.Title: “Well Place For Everything”
Reviews.Author: Brian32
Reviews.Content: Sadly the Almirante is not up to the same 4* standards as the other Confortel hotel we stayed in, the decor was a little 'tired', to be polite. It is a smaller 'City' hotel. The staff were all friendly and helpful, and we found the hotel was kept clean and fresh, as were our rooms. We were on the first floor, with a small balcony overlooking the main road. The windows and doors were double glazed x 2, two sets of d/glazing so you did not hear any of the traffic noise. The bedding and towels were changed daily. There is a 'free' mini bar provided in the room, something that I have never come across. Cola, Water, Juice and beers, all replaced daily. Free use of the room safe, €20 returnable deposit for the key. There is also free access to the wifi facilities throughout the hotel and two pc's available in reception, again free of charge. We were board only so I can't comment on the food. What was the face saving attraction for the Almirante was its' postion on C/Via Laietana, yes, a busy road but leads to everywhere. A bus stop outside the door of the hotel, metro a hundred yards. The City Tour Buses stop about 50 yards away (this must not be missed). Barceloneta, the beach area and port is a 10 ten minute walk. Barcelona Cathedral 5 minutes. The lively area of La Ramblas is only a short stroll away. You are spoilt for choice for places to eat, but check out the restaurants along the port if you enjoy seafood. Not one of the best hotels I agree but its position cannot be beaten, worth a visit.

Reviews.Title: “No more than 2 stars”
Reviews.Author: YassCairo
Reviews.Content: To starts with, please don’t get deceived by the photos on the hotel’s website. When we arrived, they checked us in a very small room that looks more like a prison cell and we had to complain to be moved to a little bit bigger room which was also ugly and noisy. They don’t have a bell boy so you have to carry your bags yourself. The elevator is too small and takes ages to arrive. The staff speaks very little English so it’s very difficult to communicate with them. The people at the reception are lazy and not willing to help with flight confirmation. The breakfast has limited varieties. Please avoid this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad At All”
Reviews.Author: SunderlandTrippers
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel after reading reviews, some of which weren't all that good but we decided to take a chance as this is the area we wanted to be in. We were very pleasantly surprised. We had asked for a room on a high floor and we were on the 5th floor so that was ok.(its worth asking for a high floor) The room was large, very clean with a lovely bathroom with clean fluffy towels and lots of little extra's. The room had a mini fridge which had a couple of beers, water and soft drinks which were free.The breakfast was plentiful with lots of variety and the staff were friendly and helpful.The hotel is in a great location and dont miss a trip to the cathedral oppositeas it is a wonderful building. The only downside we found was that as we were on the main street it was quite noisy but we bought ear plugs and we were fine. We are returning to Barcelona and we will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “good but noisey comings and goings in the night”
Reviews.Author: jazzstew
Reviews.Content: Good Hotel well situated to get around and see everything - close to some excellent restaurants. Friendly staff who speak excellent english. We had specifically asked for non smoking rooms ,but they tried to give us smoking rooms - were changed to non smoking when we objected. Rooms are all well appionted - modern recently refurbished . We were two couples one room was excellent on top floor (8) with balcony with view of street and Cathederal . The other on floor below (7) had no view and opened onto lightwell with wall two metres away - very dismal outlook. Ask for room on top floor with view of street or any floor with view of street. We were woken in the night by people coming in or going out late on two out of three nights. Get to breakfast early or it may run out if Hotel is full . All in all we enjoyed our stay in Barcelona and would consider this Hotel if we return for its position alone.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, pleasant satff clean and modern”
Reviews.Author: Arcadia31
Reviews.Content: I booked the hotel through Lastminute.com secret hotels- came here to read the reviews and was worried! I need not have been as the hotel was in a great location, had friendly staff and has recently been refurbished. The room was small but was well designed with flat screen TV, great shower, soft fluffy towels and large comfortable bed. I think for the price the hotel was perfectly fine. We didn't have breakfast there but had coffee and croissants in a cafe next door. As for all the negative reviews I think a lot have been written pre the refurbishment of the hotel and are no longer relevant.

Reviews.Title: “Not recommended”
Reviews.Author: blofeld1965
Reviews.Content: Let me start this review on a postive note. The area the hotel is located in is very good for exploring Barcelona. Only a 5-10 minute walk from Las Ramblas, 15 mins from the port, etc. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The rooms were clean with quite nice decor and modern. Breakfast was very good too. Now for the negative. We were on the first floor (we had two rooms) at the front of the hotel. The noise from the Irish bar below went on until 3.00am. The air conditioning in the rooms didn't work other than to make the room hotter. Many other guests on our floor had the same problem. If you opened the windows the noise from the main road outside was unbearable. There is no bar and no restaurant, although they do have a gym which is very small. The hotel is categorised as 4 star and we paid over £100 per night for each of our two rooms. I wouldn't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fab Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Titiangold
Reviews.Content: Just back from spending 3 nights at this hotel & have absolutely no complaints!! Our room (705) was huge for two people, the bathroom a good size as well with a bath big enough for 3 (in fact the room looked exactly like the hotel photos on this site)! The beds were comfy although it was two singles pushed together, room spotless & cleaned each day with fresh towels & toiletries. The free mini-bar was a nice touch too! Couldn't fault the public areas of the hotel but didn't use the restaurant so can't comment & there was no sign of the building work mentioned in previous reviews. The location was great as a base for exploring the city with many attractions near by & it's not far to the metro.

Reviews.Title: “very average hotel”
Reviews.Author: littlemissnat
Reviews.Content: We arrived and they had no record of our booking (thanks to a totally useless budget website we booked with!) Thankfully, the staff were helpful and got us a room, but god knows what would have happened if we'd booked in the busy summer period. We had a double room. Good points: The room was absolutely immaculate and cleaned every day The minibar was free! Including beer and wine We got free toiletries etc The location - about 5 min walk to the harbour, 10 min to La Rambla etc and a tourist bus stop right outside the front door Bad points: The room was tiny! This was fine for me and my boyfriend, but would have been extremely cramped if we'd been overweight! The bed was rather small as well. The noise! Our window faced into a courtyard towards residential apartments - we could other people and also the deafening noise of traffic from the main road The air-con didn't work. Thankfully this wasn't too much of an issue due to it being winter! The restaurant - we didn't actually manage to find it until our last day there! Renovation work - there was dust and dirt in reception area and the lift. All in all, I would recommend this hotel to those wanting budget-style accomodation. You really couldn't beat the location. But it was definitely more 3* then 4*!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: splashofclass
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel as a top secret with last minute.com. Lovely hotel decor was minimist asked for a room with a window as previous rports had mentioned this, there was no problem. Room was adequate bathroom had all you required, towels lovely and soft. soft drinks in minibar free, also very good hairdryer in situ. Hotel staff very helpful. we went for a two day break to barcelona the location was great for the gothic quarter, las ramblas and the harbour. there was a nice little bar called Mcarthys two doors away which was good for a nightcap friendly staff there. On the Friday we had a beautiful tapas meal but i cant remember the name but in the window it had been recommended by the times. whilst we were there the christmas market was on about fifty yards from the hotel i could have stayed there all day. All in all barcelona is a beautiful city and we will certainly return and probably to the same hotel

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Betsy2006
Reviews.Content: A well located hotel that has just undergone renovation. Some of the finishing touches have not yet been completed but on the whole we spent 3 very confortable nights here. The room was smallish but you cannot expect too much more from a hotel located in the centre of the city (who goes to Barcelona to stay in their room?!) The room was clean and the beds were comfotable, we had a room on a busy main road however it wasn't disturbing at night. We rang ahead and requested a room with a window / main road and got it. The location is unbeatable. I would recommend this hotel due to location but do agree with previous reviews that it is not 4* - whoever rated the hotel must have had far to much local wine. Which by the way was fantastic and so was the Tapas.. :o)

Reviews.Title: “Unhappy!”
Reviews.Author: Me-again2
Reviews.Content: We requested a 4* Hotel and expected 4* quality Room although clean had no view from window apart from dirty appartments with noisey residents. No coffee/tea facilities in room only mini bar. Breakfast was a complete dissapointment- poor cereal selection and what was cooked was always cold and of poor quality. The lift aswell as being very small was also very unreliable and in most cases it was quicker to walk up the stairs! Building work started at 8 am each day and was very noisey. Health and Safety considerations were poor. In its favour the location was excellent being in the centre of shopping area and about 100 yards from nearest underground.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid at all costs”
Reviews.Author: rachelamanda
Reviews.Content: I would consider myself quite an easy person to please but paying 190€ for a night to stay in what was little more than a cell like room in a building site was too much to take with out complaining. All of which proved completely ineffectual as the receptionists were completly unfazed by our not unreasonable complaints but we were told there was no management around till monday ( we were there for Saturday night only) and if we wanted to fill out the hoja de reclamaciones (and official complaints book) as I requested we would have to go to an official building which probably wasn't open on Saturday. So consequently we didn't bother. The hotel has nothing to offer, there is obviously building work going on as there were bags of cement left lying around, holes in walls and builders hand prints on just about every wall but even when this is complete I fail to see how the hotel will be much improved. This hotel should rate no more than a 2 star by any stretch of the imagination. Take note of all the other reviews as I failed to and stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Criminal Enterprise. Stay away. Filthy and crooked.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I reserved a room on their internet site and paid for our room with a VISA card a month before we arrived. We received our VISA bill and paid that as well before arriving in Spain. Upon arrival the hotel denied us our room although I showed them the receipts from Visa as well as from their own hotel, which they had emailed me. They insisted on processing my card again, however, and we were stock with a second bill when we arrived home. We are trying to fight this still. Meanwhile, the hotel does not give out a phone number that works (the one on the receipt does not allow a caller to contact them) and there is no email address. This enterprise is a small fleabag dump. It is a joke to consider it a four star hotel, and a cruel joke at that. It's just disgusting, noisy and old. I have reported this criminal enterpsise to the American Embassy in Spain as well as to Spanish authorities. If there is anyone reading this who has had a similar experience, I strongly urge you to do the same. Stay away. Do not be vicitized.
